instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.WS_KBD_ONOFF_L: What is WS_KBD_ONOFF_L? WS_KBD_ONOFF_L is a signal that comes from the keyboard that tells the SMC that the power button has been pressed.  L means whatever before the L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. This signal directly affects SMC_ONOFF_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
threads.message: i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> i put new keyboard but board still doesn't see it. I have signals on all pin the only signal missing is <SIGNAL>WS_KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
threads.message: Not even one key is working or just the power button?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
threads.message: nothing i checked all the keys. They might sent me bad keyboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
threads.message: my only concern was  <SIGNAL>WS_KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> but on the schematics i see that signal goes out that makes me think is bad keyboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a DOESN'T recognize new keyboard
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>WS_KBD_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is the on/off button and should be 3.4V at the connector.

It is probably a bad trackpad or flat cable, try flat cable first.
